# VIVIM Documentation

## Project Overview

**VIVIM** is the first sovereign foundational layer for AI content â€” building a user-owned knowledge graph distributed on a user-owned blockchain.

### Vision
- Your Knowledge. Your Rules. Your Chain.
- Reclaim ownership of your AI interactions
- Build your second brain
- Control your digital destiny

### Core Principles
1. **User Ownership** - Your data belongs to you, not the AI providers
2. **Privacy First** - End-to-end encryption and isolated user contexts
3. **Decentralization** - P2P sync and federated architecture
4. **Universal Capture** - Support for multiple AI providers (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.)

## Technology Stack

### Frontend Layer
- React 19, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Vite 7
- Framer Motion, Zustand, TanStack Query
- Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline support

### Backend Layer
- Bun Runtime, Express 5, Prisma ORM, PostgreSQL
- Redis for caching and pub/sub
- Socket.IO for real-time communication
- AI SDK (OpenAI, Anthropic)

### Decentralized Layer
- LibP2P for P2P networking
- Yjs CRDT for conflict-free data synchronization
- WebRTC for peer-to-peer communication
- @noble/crypto for encryption

## Architecture Components

### 1. PWA Frontend (`/docs/pwa/overview`)
- Component library with 80+ components
- 18 custom hooks for state management
- Offline-first architecture with IndexedDB
- Service worker for caching and offline access

### 2. Network Engine (`/docs/network/overview`)
- LibP2P integration for P2P networking
- CRDT synchronization (Yjs)
- DHT for content discovery
- PubSub system for real-time messaging
- Federation support

### 3. Server API (`/docs/api/overview`)
- RESTful API with 300+ endpoints
- WebSocket support for real-time updates
- Dynamic Context Engine with 8-layer pipeline
- Capture Service for AI conversation import

### 4. SDK Core (`/docs/sdk/overview`)
- TypeScript SDK for building VIVIM-compatible apps
- API Nodes for extensible functionality
- CLI for project management
- Bun integration for runtime

## Key Features

### Storage V2 (`/docs/pwa/storage-v2`)
- Content-addressed DAG storage
- Cryptographic verification
- Efficient deduplication

### BYOK (`/docs/pwa/byok`)
- Bring Your Own Key
- Use your own API keys for privacy
- Complete data sovereignty

### Context Pipeline (`/docs/architecture/pipeline`)
- 8-layer parallel processing pipeline
- Hyper-optimized streaming context
- ACU (Attention, Context, Understanding) extraction

### Security (`/docs/security/overview`)
- End-to-end encryption
- Per-user isolated contexts
- Quantum-resistant cryptography

## Development Commands

```bash
# Install dependencies
bun run setup:deps

# Generate database clients
bun run setup:db

# Run all services concurrently
bun run dev

# Or run individual services
bun run dev:pwa        # PWA frontend
bun run dev:server     # API server
bun run dev:network   # Network engine

# Build all packages
bun run build
```
